results.title: Minga: we work together
results.creator_credit: Don Whyte and Reynolds Film Productions
results.brief_description: Presents aspects of the lives of South American Indians living in Northern Ecuador. Shows weaving (which is the main source of income), the sharing of resources within the community, the activities of the town’s market place and the types of housing and diet. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Mind-slaughter
results.brief_description: A look at the atmosphere of the earth and other planets as oceans of gases providing planetary life-support systems, and the consequences of an experiment to create an atmosphere for human habitation on another planet at the cost of existing life forms. Dramatically presented but fascinating comparative analysis, nonetheless, of earth and venus’s atmosphere - with a view to human habitation on the latter. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Milk for the nation
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Ingrams, Michael Curtis, National Milk Productivity Council and W S Crawford Ltd
results.brief_description: The development of railways in Britain encouraged an interest in milk-marketing hygiene. The purity of British milk today is the result of painstaking research since that time. immense care is taken in every aspect of milk marketing. Veterinary inspectors ensure that the cattle are disease free, and laboratory assistants supervise every stage of its journey. They examine the milk during transport, and through the automatic pasteurisation, bottling and sealing processes. Narrated by Ronald Baddiley.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jonathan Ingrams, Michael Curtis, National Milk Productivity Council and W S Crawford Ltd

results.title: Midwife: with woman
results.creator_credit: Mary Paul Wells and Maternity Centre Association
results.brief_description: This film traces the history of midwifery in America, describing its prominent role in colonial times, and its gradual restriction through professional standardisation. It also shows the process through which midwifery has regained acceptance and the film emphasises the view that pregnancy is not an illness and childbirth is not a surgical operation. Narrated by Mariette Hartley.

results.title: Microsurgical replantation
results.brief_description: Focuses on microsurgery and the successful “replantation” of fingers and toes with full use and feelings. This program also explains the problems associated with finding the necessary parts (including veins) that are needed for a successful operation. Finally emphasis is made on the need for continued research in the area of microsurgery. Contains some graphic images.

results.title: Microsurgery workshop
results.brief_description: Every year Dr Earl Owen at Sydney’s Prince of Wales Hospital conducts a two day work shop in microsurgery for other interested doctors. The film shows doctors working on models and live patients while Dr Owen explains some operating techniques which he uses particularly in cases of severed fingers.

results.title: Microphone speaking
results.brief_description: Teaches the proper use of microphones in public address systems and radio. The microphone can be a help or a hindrance, depending upon how the speaker uses it. How would Lincoln’s Gettysburg Address have gone over if he had been constantly interrupted by feedback?

results.title: Mick Doohan
results.creator_credit: Sergi Sendra, Paco Latorre and Dorna
results.brief_description: This extensive profile of motorcycle racing world champion Mick Doohan charts the major milestones of his remarkable career from 1992-1996. Footage of his most memorable races is backgrounded by an extensive personal interview. His family, mechanics, friends and race rivals also give insights into his personal life and career.

results.title: Michigan, USA
results.brief_description: Michigan in the heart of America surrounded by the Great Lakes offers entertainment, relaxation, scenic beauty and history to the visitor. Detroit city, the ultimate in modern civilization and industrialisation; nostalgic Mackinac Island where motor vehicles are prohibited; historic Greenfield Village with its blacksmith; water sports on the numerous lakes, and exciting winter sports are but a few of the attractions.
